SimpleEvaluation

enspire.interactivity.evaluation.IEvaluation
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.SimpleEvaluation

This is the most basic implementation of IEvaluation.  This is the Evaluation type you should use if you only need to know the correctness of a users answer, and possibly the number of attempts by the user.  If you require more in depth information to be contained within these evaluations, simply extend from this class.

Summary
SimpleEvaluationThis is the most basic implementation of IEvaluation.
Variables
correct
numTries
Functions
SimpleEvaluation
setCorrectFunction used by an Evaluator when generating this evaluation to set the correctness of the user’s attempt.
getCorrectReturns true if the user’s most recent attempt at the interactivity was correct, false otherwise.
getNumTriesReturns the number of times that the user has attempted the current interactivity.
setNumTriesFunction used by an Evaluator when generating this evaluation to set the number of attempts/tries by the user.

setCorrect

public function setCorrect(correct: Boolean):Void

Function used by an Evaluator when generating this evaluation to set the correctness of the user’s attempt.

getCorrect

public function getCorrect():Boolean

Returns true if the user’s most recent attempt at the interactivity was correct, false otherwise.

getNumTries

public function getNumTries():Number

Returns the number of times that the user has attempted the current interactivity.  The first evaluation generated by the activity will return 1 when getNumTries() is called on it.

setNumTries

public function setNumTries(numTries: Number)

Function used by an Evaluator when generating this evaluation to set the number of attempts/tries by the user.

Evaluations are bundles of data representing the current state of an activity.
